Comment: Correct. They popped a hole in the firewall for whatever port they were trying to allow in but they forgot to disable the geo IP ACL’s that prevent specific external subnets from accessing the network. There are two types of incompetencies here:  1. The DOGE kids obviously do not have experience configuring complex firewall rules because they thought a simple port forward would allow Russia to connect.   2. The Russians didn’t try to change their origin IP by using something as simple as a VPN that terminates state side and would have let them connect.  It’s nice to know that our adversaries both near and far are not the brightest bulbs.
